span.p: On April 20, Governor DeWine ordered the continued closure of K-12 school buildings through the end of the 2019-20 school year. Boardman Schools will continue remote instruction.

div.a: FINAL 9-WEEKS : IMPORTANT DATES

img.alt: important dates graphic

a.title: Click to read more about: FINAL 9-WEEKS : IMPORTANT DATES

div.a: Read More about FINAL 9-WEEKS : IMPORTANT DATES
ODE ADVISES SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO HOLD VIRTUAL COMMENCEMENTS/EVENTS

img.alt: Ohio Department of Education graphic

p.span: On April 23, the Ohio Department of Education issued this statement to school districts across Ohio, urging districts to cancel in person commencements and hold virtual graduation ceremonies instead. ODE also advised not to postpone school events into the summer months.
Read more by CLICKING HERE TO READ ODE STATEMENT ON GRADUATION AND RECOGNITION CEREMONIES

a.title: Click to read more about: ODE ADVISES SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO HOLD VIRTUAL COMMENCEMENTS/EVENTS

div.a: Read More about ODE ADVISES SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO HOLD VIRTUAL COMMENCEMENTS/EVENTS
Boardman School Board Will Hold Virtual Meeting Monday, April 27

img.alt: school board meeting on chalkboard graphic

span.b: Boardman Local Schools will virtually hold its regularly scheduled Board of Education meeting on Monday, April 27. Board members will conduct the meeting via the “Zoom” app. The meeting will be live streamed through Boardman’s official school YouTube Channel: BSTN-TV YouTube.

a.title: Click to read more about: Boardman School Board Will Hold Virtual Meeting Monday, April 27

div.a: Read More about Boardman School Board Will Hold Virtual Meeting Monday, April 27
Superintendent Saxton's Update for Class of 2020

img.alt: new update graphic

span.strong: Mr. Saxton talks about upcoming dates and plans for the Class of 2020. Please click read more to watch his message.

a.title: Click to read more about: Superintendent Saxton's Update for Class of 2020

div.a: Read More about Superintendent Saxton's Update for Class of 2020
BOARDMAN MEAL DISTRIBUTIONS EVERY MONDAY UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

img.alt: MEAL DISTRIBUTION AT BHS WITH RYAN STACKING TABLES

span.p: All children, regardless of income, from the ages of 1-18 are eligible for meals: 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches for the week. Children should be present. A drive-thru type of pickup from Doors 8 & 9 (North).

span.span: will be the next Scheduled Meal Distribution.

a.title: Click to read more about: BOARDMAN MEAL DISTRIBUTIONS EVERY MONDAY UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

div.a: Read More about BOARDMAN MEAL DISTRIBUTIONS EVERY MONDAY UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
SENIORS CLASS OF 2020: YARD SIGNS DELIVERED!

img.alt: boardman senior 2020 yard signs stacked on tables for delivery

span.strong: Boardman senior class of 2020, your signs are delivered!
On April 22, dozens of volunteers--your teachers, counselors, administrators, and so many others who love you--were excited to place these in your yards.

a.title: Click to read more about: SENIORS CLASS OF 2020: YARD SIGNS DELIVERED!

div.a: Read More about SENIORS CLASS OF 2020: YARD SIGNS DELIVERED!
View More

strong.span: A group from Sunrise Senior Living visited Robinwood Elementary School in September, and joined in a gym class with kindergarten students. It was part of Sunrise's "Move 4 LIfe" campaign. Sunrise has 300 facilities across the nation, and on this day, each location had a group join in similar fun at schools across the country. Robinwood students were overjoyed to host them for a relay race.

img.alt: Senior citizens from sunrise Senior Living at the entrance of Robinwood Elementary
Loraine and a group of students share a snack after the relay races
